body_html:
Problem is that you're not freezing the graph, which converts variables into constants.

Before you call the TOCO convert, you need to convert variables to constants to produce a frozen graph def. Then pipe that frozen graph def into the TOCO convert.

Right now, you're referencing the sess.graph_def instead of the frozen graph.
body_text:
Problem is that you're not freezing the graph, which converts variables into constants.
Before you call the TOCO convert, you need to convert variables to constants to produce a frozen graph def. Then pipe that frozen graph def into the TOCO convert.
Right now, you're referencing the sess.graph_def instead of the frozen graph.
body:
Problem is that you're not freezing the graph, which converts variables into constants.

Before you call the TOCO convert, you need to convert variables to constants to produce a frozen graph def. Then pipe that frozen graph def into the TOCO convert.

Right now, you're referencing the sess.graph_def instead of the frozen graph.
